quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Term and State
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, piero, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: An ambassador is the highest ranking diplomat.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of these was painted by Italian painter Sandro Botticelli, nicknamed Il Botticello The Little Barrel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What does a consul do?

options.text: A consul assists and protect the citizens of the consuls own country
He is a representative from one head of state to another.
The duties of a consul are the same as the duties of an ambassador.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A consul assists and protect the citizens of the consuls own country

questions.question: What term used in diplomacy indicates a proscription against a person entering the country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Persona non grata

questions.question: What term refers to a formal meeting between a head of state and another person?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Audience

questions.question: What term refers to the easing of strained relations, especially in a political situation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Détente

questions.question: What painter of the Parma school of the Italian Renaissance created “Jupiter and Io”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Antonio da Correggio

questions.question: Piero della Francescas painting was characterised by the use of geometric forms.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of these was completed after Michelangelos death?

options.text: The ceiling of the Sistine Chapel
The dome of Saint Peter’s Basillica

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The dome of Saint Peter’s Basillica

questions.question: What Venetian painter was called by his contemporaries The Sun Amidst Small Stars?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Titian (Tiziano Vecelli)

questions.question: Which of Leonardo Da Vinci’s works was a key element leading to the Holy Grail in the novel The Da Vinci Code?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Last Supper

questions.question: An Apostolic Nuncio is a permanent diplomatic representative of the Vatican to a state or international organization.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Virgin Annunciate was the last work of which Italian painter from Sicily?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Antonello da Messina

questions.question: What term refers to a letter of protest presented by one states foreign ministry to another state?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: diplomatic note

questions.question: What term indicates a group of people from one state present in another state to represent the sending state?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Diplomatic mission

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Bing Crosby and Judy Garland
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, di, piero. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Bing Crosby was an advocate for the legalization of what drug?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: marijuana

questions.question: What famous Composer wrote the song White Christmas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Irving Berlin

questions.question: What sport other than baseball did Bing Crosby have an interest in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: thoroughbred horse racing

questions.question: What university did Bing Crosby attend?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gonzaga

questions.question: What was the first movie Judy Garland didnt sing in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Clock

questions.question: Judy Garlands parents emigrated from Europe to the US in the early 1900s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Judy Garland was always close to her mother and sisters.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Bing Crosby exerted an important influence in the development of what technology?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Piero di Lorenzo, who painted “Portrait of Simonetta Vespucci”, is also known by what other name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Piero di Cosimo

questions.question: What Italian painter of the early Renaissance and died at the age of 27?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Masaccio

questions.question: What was Judy Garlands birth name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frances Ethel Gumm

questions.question: What faith was Bing Crosby a member of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roman Catholic

questions.question: Bing Crosby was the original singer of how many Oscar-winning songs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4

questions.question: Paolo Uccello was an Italian painter and mathematician.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is the last film Judy Garland made for MGM?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Summer Stock

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Movie and Fatso
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, kind. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The actress who played this Star Trek character ended up marrying a co-star after becoming pregnant.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kira Nerys

questions.question: This actor from Star Trek: Deep Space Nine was in fact one of the original finalists to play the role of Capitan Benjamin Sisko in the series.

options.text: Alexander Siddig who played Dr. Bashir
Colm Meany who played Miles OBrien

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alexander Siddig who played Dr. Bashir

questions.question: What kind of a store do the DiNapolis have in the neighborhood in the movie Fatso?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a card store

questions.question: Gene Roddenberry was married to this actress who also starred in the Star Trek series.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Majel Barrett

questions.question: Prior to creating Star Trek: The Next Generation, Gene Roddenberry held this occupation.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Police Officer

questions.question: What was the name of the place where Dom used to buy his fruit in the movie Fatso?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Balduccis

questions.question: Bing Crosby is in the World Golf Hall of Fame.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The person who played this Star Trek character had several recurring appearances on the sitcom Night Court as a down on his luck criminal.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Data

questions.question: In the movie Fatso, Dominicks sister sends him out to go get dinner. Upon returning home, he decides to binge eat and devours the whole order. What food did he eat in the car on the way home?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chinese food

questions.question: What is the name of the woman who frequents the stationary and gives Dom tips on dieting in the movie Fatso?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mrs. Goodman

questions.question: The actor who played this Star Trek character also starred on the television series CHiPS in the late 1970s - early 1980s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Worf

questions.question: The actor who played this Star Trek character also starred as Governor Gatlings Chief of Staff on the television series Benson.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Odo

questions.question: How many kids does Dom end up having in the movie Fatso?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: five

questions.question: The actress who played this Star Trek character became such good friends with castmates during her tenure on the Star Trek series that two of them were groomsmen at her wedding.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Deanna Troi

questions.question: The real life grandfather of the person who played this Star Trek character was a famous actor / musician from 1926 until his death in 1977.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tasha Yar

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Witches and Witch
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, dorothys, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What mythical Christian patriarch was believed to have ruled over a Christian nation lost amidst the Muslims and pagans?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Prester John

questions.question: What actress portrays Abigail Williams in the movie The Crucible which is centred around the Salem Witch Trials of 1692?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Winona Ryder

questions.question: The Water of Life or Fountain of Youth has been associated with which of the following locations?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: In what classic fairy tale does a cannibalistic witch live in a house of candy and cake?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hansel and Gretel

questions.question: What actress is NOT correctly matched with the witch she portrayed?

options.text: The Wicked Witch of the West - Margaret Hamilton

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Phoebe Halliwell - Shannen Doherty

questions.question: In Christian tradition, the Holy Grail, used by Jesus at the Last Supper, is most often described as which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Who penned the childrens book The Witches in which an organization of witches aims to destroy children?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roald Dahl

questions.question: This actress had a recurring role as the character Rosalind Shays on the television series L.A. Law.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Diana Muldaur

questions.question: Which of these was believed to be a talented woman who disguised herself as a man?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pope Joan

questions.question: What witch is killed when Dorothys house lands on her in the 1939 movie The Wizard of Oz?

options.text: The Wicked Witch of the East
The Wicked Witch of the South
The Wicked Witch of the West

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Wicked Witch of the East

questions.question: Tempted by the White Witchs promise of power, this character betrays his siblings in the novel The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edmund Pevensie

questions.question: What character in the play Macbeth is informed by the three witches that he will father a line of kings but he himself will not become a king?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Banquo

questions.question: What is the title of the secret book which Prue, Piper and Phoebe Halliwell find in the TV series Charmed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Book of Shadows

questions.question: Name the author of the novel The Witches of Eastwick which follows three witches who acquire their powers after leaving or being left by their husbands.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Updike

questions.question: What 1996 horror movie starring Neve Campbell centers around four teenage girls who pursue witchcraft?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Craft

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Film and Movie
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, leader, stars. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What name is given to a variety of fictional and factual events of 1212 which are related to the conversion of Muslims in the Holy Land to Christianity?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Children’s Crusade

questions.question: What is Robin Hoods group of fellow outlaws referred to as?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Merry Men

questions.question: This American epic romance and disaster film was directed by James Cameron and stars Leonardo Di Caprio.

options.text: The Man in the Iron Mask

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Titanic

questions.question: Who was the Wandering Jew according to medieval Christian folklore?

options.text: a Jew who taunted Jesus on the way to the Crucifixion
the doorman at Pontius Pilate’s estate

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: This film tells the story of a skillful cheque forger named Frank Abagnale Jr.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Catch Me If You Can

questions.question: What were incubuses and succubuses according to mythical traditions?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Male and female demons

questions.question: Which movie set in World War II focuses on two snipers trying to kill each other during the Battle of Stalingrad?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Enemy at the Gates

questions.question: Which biographic film stars Jamie Foxx in the title role?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ray

questions.question: Which film directed by Martin Scorsese is based on the life of middleweight boxer Jake LaMotta?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Raging Bull

questions.question: Name the legendary leader, who led the defence of Britain against the Saxon invaders.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: King Arthur

questions.question: What movie starring Angela Bassett  tells the life story of Tina Turner?

options.text: Whats Love Got to Do with It

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Whats Love Got to Do with It

questions.question: For which of these biographical drama did Will Smith receive an Academy Award nomination for Best Actor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Pursuit of Happiness

questions.question: Which gangster film is based on the non-fiction book Wiseguy by Nicholas Pileggi?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Goodfellas

questions.question: The war movie Black Hawk Down depicts the Battle of Mogadishu.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The names Reuben, Simeon and Gad are related to which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Lost Tribes

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Following and Enid Blyton
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, places, drama. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What nationality was Sir Arthur Ignatius Conan Doyle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Scottish

questions.question: One of Enid Blytons first books, The Secret Island, had four sequels. Which of the following is not one of them?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Secret of Cliff Castle

questions.question: Which of the following works did Arthur Conan Doyle author?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: The R Mystery series by Enid Blyton are so-called since each begins with R. They are also called  the Barney Mysteries after the circus boy who features in each one. Various animals appear in these stories.  Which of these is not one of them?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hurly-Burly the chimp

questions.question: In the Adventure series of stories the four children are Philip, Dinah, Jack and Lucy-Ann. But what was the name of the fifth important character, Jacks parrot?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kiki

questions.question: Which of these was not a girls boarding school described by Enid Blyton?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red Roofs

questions.question: Which of these sports did Arthur Conan Doyle practise?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Enid Blytons Mystery stories featured the Five Find-Outers and Dog. What was the real name of the boy known as Fatty?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frederick Algernon Trottville

questions.question: Where did Sir Arthur Conan Doyle study medicine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: University of Edinburgh

questions.question: What 1995 crime drama film stars Robert De Niroas Sam Ace Rothstein?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Casino

questions.question: Which of the following is not one of the Famous Five books by Enid Blyton?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peter

questions.question: The stories of the Folk of the Faraway Tree in the Enchanted Wood are some of Enid Blytons best loved.  Which of these characters is not encountered up the tree or in one of the magic lands that drift past?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dame Smack

questions.question: Enid Blyton wrote 15 Secret Seven books. Which of the following is the title of a real Secret Seven book?

options.text: The Secret Seven Save the Day

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Secret Seven Fireworks

questions.question: Noddy was Enid Blytons most famous creation for younger children. Which of the following is not to be found in Noddys home Toyland or Toytown?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jumpy Dog

questions.question: Which of the following is not one of the places where the Famous Five had an adventure?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marston Moor
